title: Sri Lanka wins three gold medals on SASAC opening day
byline: Sri Lankan athletes Pasindu Malshan, Chamod Yodhsingha, and Shafiya Yamick won three gold medals for Sri Lanka on the opening day of the 4th South Asian Senior Athletics Championship (SASAC) 2025.

title: Sri Lanka on track for 2026 NSW pilot
byline: Sri Lanka is on track to pilot its transformative Trade National Single Window System (TNSWS) by end-2026, with full operations expected to commence in 2027.

title: No legal barriers to religious dress for Muslim nurses: Minister
byline: Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Minister Vijitha Herath has assured that there are no legal barriers preventing Muslim nurses from adhering to their religious dress requirements while serving in government hospitals.

title: No concrete plan yet for SriLankan Airlines despite mounting losses
byline: The government has yet to firm up any plan for restructuring SriLankan Airlines, the national carrier, but remains open to possible partnerships with the private sector to increase profitability, an official said yesterday.

title: Deadline for 2025 A/L and GIT exam amendments ends Oct. 31
byline: The Department of Examinations has announced that the deadline for making amendments to names, medium, and subjects for the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination and the 2025 General Information Technology (GIT) Examination will end at midnight on October 31. The Department confirmed that no extensions will be granted beyond this date.

title: National Climate Finance Strategy for 2025 launched
byline: The National Climate Finance Strategy for 2025-2030 was launched yesterday by the Finance Ministry and United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) through the Climate Finance Network project, which was funded by the UK government.

title: Female Police Constables return lost wallet belonging to British tourist
byline: Two female Police Constables attached to the Prime Minister’s Security Division have been commended for their honesty after returning a lost wallet belonging to a foreign tourist.

title: Thailand’s Queen Mother Sirikit, influential style icon, dies at 93
byline: Thailand’s Queen Mother Sirikit, who brought glamour and elegance to a postwar revival in the country’s monarchy and who, in later years, would occasionally wade into politics, has died aged 93, the Thai Royal Household Bureau said on Saturday.

title: Prison overcrowding can’t be solved with hangings, says CPRP
byline: In response to the Prisons Commissioner’s remarks that drug traffickers sentenced to death should be hanged, the Committee for Protecting Rights of Prisoners (CPRP) yesterday criticised the statement, saying that executions are not the solution to Sri Lanka’s prison overcrowding.

title: Fire on ‘Rajarata Rejini’ train delays journey from Anuradhapura
byline: A fire broke out on the ‘Rajarata Rejini’ train operating from Anuradhapura to Beliatta, the Railway Department confirmed.

title: Showers, strong winds expected during the day
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued a weather warning, forecasting showers or thundershowers at times over Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Northwestern, Northern, and North Central provinces, as well as in Galle, Matara, and Trincomalee districts.

title: Minister urges prompt Muslim burial rites, calls for adherence to pre-COVID procedures
byline: Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism Minister Vijitha Herath has addressed concerns over delays in performing Muslim burial rites, said that final rites should be carried out promptly.

title: AI job demand in South Asia, including Sri Lanka, surges 75% Faster: World Bank
byline: The World Bank has highlighted a rapid rise in demand for artificial intelligence (AI) skills across South Asia, including Sri Lanka, noting that this trend is beginning to influence hiring patterns. Between January 2023 and March 2025, the share of AI-related job postings in the region more than doubled, increasing from 2.9% to 6.5%, growing approximately 75% faster than non-AI job listings.

title: Gayle named brand ambassador as LPL gears up for 2026 return
byline: The Lanka Premier League (LPL) has appointed West Indies cricket icon Chris Gayle as the Brand Ambassador for its upcoming sixth season, scheduled for 2026.

title: Government prioritises primary healthcare strengthening to rackle rising NCD threat
byline: Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has said that strengthening primary healthcare remains a core priority under the government’s health policy, as Sri Lanka works to curb the growing burden of non-communicable diseases (NCDs).

title: Sri Lanka Navy launches rescue mission for distressed merchant ship
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy vessel Samudura set sail on 24 October 2025 to rescue the crew of the merchant ship MV INTEGRITY STAR, which had encountered distress about 100 nautical miles south of Sri Lanka due to a technical fault in its main engines.

title: Strong winds, rough seas as depression forms in Bay of Bengal: Met Dept warns
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an amber advisory for strong winds, heavy showers, and rough seas affecting the Bay of Bengal and eastern coastal waters around Sri Lanka.

title: Firefighting awareness holiday programme for children at Ratmalana Airport
byline: Airport and Aviation Services Sri Lanka has announced a special one-day Fire Fighting Awareness Holiday Programme for children this December.

title: From Ceylon to the Louvre: The Rs. 31 Billion Heist That Stole More Than Jewels
byline: France has been shaken by one of the most spectacular museum robberies in recent memory — a daylight Louvre heist that stripped the nation of priceless royal jewellery worth more than €88 million (around Rs. 31 billion).

title: Overpriced drug purchases, unrecovered supplier payments raise concerns
byline: An audit report has revealed major financial lapses at the State Pharmaceuticals Corporation (SPC), including losses from overpriced medicine purchases and failure to recover money from suppliers.

title: SriLankan Airlines clarifies 2024/25 financial losses
byline: SriLankan Airlines has issued a statement to clarify its financial performance for the 2024/25 fiscal year, following recent reports on its reported losses.

title: Will Sri Lanka experience a spate of political killings?
byline: Opposition MP Jagath Vithane questioned as to whether Sri Lanka is going to experience a spate of political killings with the latest developments, including the killing of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman.

title: Why are we a nation that never develops?
byline: For years Sri Lanka’s geographic location has been spoken about and even envied by many nations. Infact foreigners have always praised our natural resources, our lush greenery, our ideal location in the Indian Ocean and our warmth and friendship.

title: Sri Lanka on HIV alert: Over 150,000 at risk from unsafe sex, drug practices
byline: Sri Lanka is facing a serious public health crisis, with more than 150,000 individuals engaging in unsafe sexual and drug-related behaviours, health authorities have warned. Experts fear that without immediate intervention, the country could see a sharp rise in HIV and sexually transmitted infections (STIs) in the coming years.

title: China and Russia waging ’sex warfare’ in US; send female spies after Silicon Valley secrets, target makes big revelations
byline: Chinese and Russian spies have been seen getting in touch with Silicon Valley professionals and industry insiders. Many of these operatives are seen at business conferences on Chinese investment risks.

title: Thailand’s Queen Mother Sirikit, influential style icon, dies at 93
byline: Thailand’s Queen Mother Sirikit, who brought glamour and elegance to a postwar revival in the country’s monarchy and who, in later years, would occasionally wade into politics, has died aged 93, the Thai Royal Household Bureau said on Saturday.

title: King takes 7-18 as Australia thrash South Africa
byline: Alana King returned the best figures in Women’s World Cup history as Australia hammered South Africa by seven wickets to set up a semi-final meeting with India.

title: Government has no control over law and order: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa has voiced concern over the recent spate of killings across the country, warning that law and order appear to be slipping out of government control.

title: No decision yet on driving license fee revision: DMT Commissioner General
byline: Depatment of Motor Transport (DMT) Commissioner General Kamal Amarasinghe has clarified that no final decision has been made regarding a revision of driving license fees this year.

title: Two Australian women cricketers ‘touched inappropriately’ in Indore
byline: It is learnt that the concerned players were walking to a cafe at Khajrana Road, which is roughly three kilometres from their hotel when a motorcyclist committed the offence.

title: Rain or Shine, Gear Up for a Thrilling Weekend of Sport
byline: As rain clouds drift across Sri Lanka this weekend, outdoor plans might be off — but that’s hardly bad news for sports lovers. From the Premier League’s late-night battles to India’s crucial ODI in Sydney and the roar of Formula 1 engines in Mexico, it’s shaping up to be a weekend tailor-made for staying in, curling up, and catching every moment of the global action.

title: Govt prioritises primary healthcare strengthening to tackle rising NCD threat
byline: Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has said that strengthening primary healthcare remains a core priority under the government’s health policy, as Sri Lanka works to curb the growing burden of non-communicable diseases (NCDs).

title: Ministry warns of fake WhatsApp group misusing education reform title
byline: The Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education Ministry has alerted the public to a fraudulent WhatsApp group operating under the name “Education Council to be formed through the New Education Reforms.”

title: Gazette issued allowing release of vehicles held at customs
byline: A Gazette Extraordinary has been issued outlining new regulations for the release of vehicles currently held by Sri Lanka Customs.
